channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Aya Hachem: Men jailed for student's drive-by murder
item.description: Aya Hachem was "in the wrong place at the wrong time" when she was shot in a feud between tyre firms.

item.title: Migrant crossings: Record 482 cross English Channel in one day
item.description: According to Home Office figures, there have now been 10,236 arrivals in 434 boats so far in 2021.

item.title: Bournemouth beach closed after 'large animal' spotted in sea
item.description: Visitors say there was a shark sighting, though lifeguards were unable to identify the animal.

item.title: Greater Manchester Police officer in court accused of sexual assaults
item.description: Mohammed Adnan Ali, 35, faces 21 charges including five sexual assaults between 2015 and 2018.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: 'Extra special' as twins, say Gadirova sisters
item.description: Jessica and Jennifer Gadirova, 16, return to Britain after securing team bronze in the gymnastics.

item.title: Ever Given: Ship that blocked Suez Canal leaves Felixstowe
item.description: The Ever Given leaves Felixstowe after 2,000 containers were unloaded.

item.title: Covid: Fifth of England hospital admissions aged 18-34
item.description: The new NHS chief executive urges unvaccinated young adults to get jabbed, saying it is "so important".

item.title: Covid vaccine refuser died after terrible mistake, says partner
item.description: Leslie Lawrenson died and his partner became seriously ill with Covid after they refused vaccines.

item.title: James Hollett: Man denies speeding at over 200mph on M23
item.description: A police investigation was launched after footage showing a speeding motorists was posted online.

item.title: Parton landslip: Evacuees allowed to return home
item.description: An inspection of the hillside above the homes in Parton finds no signs of recent movement.

item.title: Driver finds escaped lizard in car
item.description: A driver made the unusual discovery and called the RSPCA for help.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The government is expected to announce that 16 and 17-year-olds will receive the Covid vaccine.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government has updated its red, amber and green lists of countries.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Covid: When will teenagers get the jab and do I need a booster?
item.description: More teenagers will be able to receive the Covid vaccine, and a third jab will soon be available for the most vulnerable.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Wolverhampton proud of Ben Whittaker
item.description: Friends and family in Wolverhampton couldn't be prouder of the silver medallist.

item.title: Covid: Wigan nurse's photos capture life in intensive care unit
item.description: Nurse Petro Bekker's photos of her team in the intensive care unit are to feature in an exhibition.

item.title: Wigan family rescue deer from drowning in canal
item.description: Chris and Denver Kendall, from Wigan, tied two dog leads together to pull the animal to safety.

item.title: Dog-snatching thief filmed by doorbell camera in Horndean
item.description: A 13-year-old boy was walking his border terrier Melchy when he was pushed out of the way.

item.title: Basketball: Chatham teenager gets scholarship to play for top US side
item.description: Tamara Fournillier-Onadeko, who plays at youth level in the GB squad, is heading to Chicago.

item.title: London riots: Youth services cut in half since unrest
item.description: London's young people have missed out on Â£240m of investment over the last 10 years, figures show.

item.title: Sex abuser jailed for grooming 15-year-old
item.description: Malcolm Peter Barwick is jailed for six-and-a-half years for abusing the teenager.

item.title: York Minster: Queen's jubilee statue approved
item.description: The design of the statue will be chosen by the Queen and is due to be unveiled next year.

item.title: London's Royal Parks depicts devastating effect of litter
item.description: Litter weighing the equivalent of 157 double-decker buses was collected in the space of a year.

item.title: Rutland Osprey Project celebrates after 200th chick fledges
item.description: The Rutland Osprey Project reaches the milestone as it marks 25 years since it began.

item.title: Jofra Archer: England bowler to miss T20 World Cup and Ashes
item.description: England fast bowler Jofra Archer will miss this winter's T20 World Cup and the Ashes tour of Australia with a stress facture of the elbow.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB's Matt Walls wins omnium gold
item.description: Team GB cyclist Matt Walls is crowned Olympic champion on his debut with a dominant performance in the men's omnium.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Holly Bradshaw claims bronze in pole vault for Team GB
item.description: Holly Bradshaw claims Britain's second track and field medal in Tokyo and finally lands her first major championship podium finish with bronze in the pole vault.
